column2: A minimum amount must be used from the Committed spend each Billing Period (use-it or lose-it). In this case, the contract requires a minimum of a $60s to be spent each month

In the first month, the Customer uses $48 of services (4 server hours). This usage has a List Cost of $60 (before discounts). For this month, Acme charges 12$ (ListCost of $15) for not meeting the monthly minimum.
In the following 2 months, the customer has usage at or above the minimum requirement
After that, AwesomeCorp does not use Acme services and gets a charge each month for the minimum spend of $60.
On the final month of the contract ChargePeriod, Acme charges the total unused portion of the contract
On April 1 2025, AwesomeCorp agrees to spend $1200 (post-discounts) in the upcoming 12-months at Acme Co with a $1200 up-front payment

AwesomeCorp receives a 20% negotiated discount in return for the commitment. In this case, the spend commitment is tallied up *after discounts* (like the negotiated discounts) are applied. Providers could use cost prior to discounts i.e., List Cost for their committed spend calculations as well.
Same as Scenario A1 above, except for the pre-payment and subsequent usage and fee-records not having a Billed Cost (since everything was paid up-front)

column13: $1200 pre-payment for usage in the next 12 months
